snippet: Character matters as much as schoolwork, or maybe even more. And new initiatives are showing how it can be taught.
abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column cites Paul Tough book How Children Succeed, which suggests that character skills may be more important to a child's long-term success than math and reading; notes that several education initiatives across the country are having success teaching such skills as resilience, integrity and resourcefulness.
lead_paragraph: Character matters as much as schoolwork, or maybe even more. And new initiatives are showing how it can be taught.
